Class Fly

java.lang.Object
Fly
public class Fly
extends java.lang.Object
Contains several methods that aid in the
display and movement of Mosca

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    protected java.awt.image.BufferedImage image  
    protected static java.lang.String imgFile  
    protected GridLocation location  
    protected FlyWorld world  

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    Fly​(GridLocation loc, FlyWorld fw)
    Creates a new Fly object.
    The image file for a fly is fly.jpg

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    java.awt.image.BufferedImage getImage()  
    GridLocation getLocation()  
    boolean isPredator()  
    java.lang.String toString()
    Returns a string representation of this Fly showing the location coordinates and the world.
    void update​(int direction)
    This method updates the fly's location in
    the world
    The fly can move in one of the four cardinal (N, S, E, W) directions.
    You need to make sure that the updated location
    is within the bounds of the world before
    changing the location of the fly

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • Fly

      public Fly​(GridLocation loc, FlyWorld fw)
      Creates a new Fly object.
      The image file for a fly is fly.jpg
      Parameters:
      loc - a GridLocation
      fw - the FlyWorld the fly is in

  • Method Details

    • getImage

      public java.awt.image.BufferedImage getImage()
      Returns:
      BufferedImage, the image of the fly

    • getLocation

      public GridLocation getLocation()
      Returns:
      GridLocation, the location of the fly

    • isPredator

      public boolean isPredator()
      Returns:
      boolean, always false, Mosca is not a predator

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a string representation of this Fly showing the location coordinates and the world.
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
      Returns:
      the string representation

    • update

      public void update​(int direction)
      This method updates the fly's location in
      the world
      The fly can move in one of the four cardinal (N, S, E, W) directions.
      You need to make sure that the updated location
      is within the bounds of the world before
      changing the location of the fly
      Parameters:
      direction - one of the four cardinal directions
      Given as constants in FlyWorldGUI

      They are:
      FlyWorldGUI.NORTH
      FlyWorldGUI.SOUTH
      FlyWorldGUI.EAST
      FlyWorldGUI.WEST
